result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:27 AM Defendant Alan P Tolstyga in court.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn appeared by Zoom for Alan P Tolstyga.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Attorney Andrea Will in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Atty. Cleghorn requests an adjournment.  State does not object.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Letter requesting adjournment filed by Atty Cleghorn**Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 10/19 "DENIED. Marsy's Law issue. If no objection matter may be set for status on Prelim. Attorney may appear by Zoom, Defendant to appear in person."

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B (EXCEPTION: 3rd party contact for the sole purpose of an insurance claim) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

8:55 AM Defendant Alan P Tolstyga in court.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Alan P Tolstyga.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
